SENT.plain: We report on an unusual case of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension (IIH) in a woman of normal weight
Papilledema and increased intracranial pressure are symptoms of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis or idiopathic intrancranial hypertension
Because of the different treatment strategies, it is important to keep these two diseases separate
We show that the use of different imaging methods is an important tool in obtaining an effective diagnosis
